Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is a common disease of peppers and tomatoes. It is caused by several species of Xanthomonas bacteria. The disease can cause spots on leaves, stems, and fruits. The spots are initially small, water-soaked, and circular. They later become dark and sunken. The disease can lead to defoliation and reduced yield.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight is a fungal disease of potatoes and tomatoes caused by Alternaria solani. The disease causes dark, circular lesions on leaves, stems, and tubers. The lesions have a characteristic 'target spot' appearance. The disease can cause defoliation and reduced yield.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Use fungicides such as chlorothalonil or mancozeb.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot of tomato is caused by four species of Xanthomonas. The disease causes spots on leaves, stems, and fruits. The spots are initially small, water-soaked, and circular. They later become dark and sunken. The disease can lead to defoliation and reduced yield.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts.

Tomato_Late_blight.description: Late blight is a devastating disease of tomatoes and potatoes caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans. The disease can cause large, water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits. The lesions can spread rapidly and destroy the entire plant. The disease is favored by cool, moist weather.
remedies: Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Use fungicides such as chlorothalonil, mancozeb, or metalaxyl.
Ensure good air circulation around plants.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV) is a DNA virus from the genus Begomovirus. It is transmitted by whiteflies. The virus causes stunting, upward curling of leaves, and yellowing of leaf margins. The disease can cause severe yield losses.
remedies: Use reflective mulches to repel whiteflies.
